intro: Dimorphocalyx pauciflorus, commonly known as the little-flowered evergreen, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are usually elliptical or ovate in shape. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its unique floral structure and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
